author: fradamt
content: At least in theory there's no reason why this should be the case, unless reconstruction is not fast enough. And even if it were not fast enough, this should only have a small effect in a network where *most* of the stake is held by nodes that download everything. Most proposals and most attesting weight would behave as if there was no sampling, and there should only be temporary deviations of full nodes which are quickly resolved as soon as reconstruction happens.

author: manunlp
content:
The network has 33.333...% of super nodes, 66.666...% of full nodes.

In the [devnet](https://dora.peerdas-devnet-3.ethpandaops.io/forks), 33.333...% (6/18) of synced nodes are super nodes. 
I'm not sure if it can prove anything, but at least the proportion of synced super nodes wrt. synced full nodes is exactly the same than the proportion of super nodes wrt. full nodes in the network.
